issues.description: The problem statement specifies a constructor SealSaloon(String) (to accept a saloon name) but the reference solution implements only a no‐argument constructor SealSaloon(). This mismatch will confuse students as they will follow the UML/spec but find a different signature in the provided code and tests.
issues.suggested_fix: Either update the solution (and template) to include a constructor public SealSaloon(String name) matching the specification, or adjust the problem statement/UML to use a no‐argument constructor to align all artifacts.

issues.description: The problem statement specifies a SealSaloon constructor that accepts a String (saloon name), but the solution implementation provides only a no-argument constructor. This mismatch in constructor signature will confuse students about how to instantiate SealSaloon and map the requirement to the implementation.
